com.sun.faces.extensions.avatar.lifecycle
Class PartialTraversalLifecycle

java.lang.Object
  javax.faces.lifecycle.Lifecycle
      com.sun.faces.extensions.avatar.lifecycle.PartialTraversalLifecycle

public class PartialTraversalLifecycle
extends javax.faces.lifecycle.Lifecycle

In order to preserve the ability to use server side template text to aid in formatting the AJAX response, it is necessary to allow the render response phase to execute "mostly" normally. The departures from normalcy include:

  1. The template text above and belowthe <f:view> tag must be discarded.

  2. Any output from ResponseWriter.startDocument() and endDocument() must be discarded.

  3. A distinct set of subtrees of the view are rendered, rather than the whole view.

To accomodate these vagaries, this custom Lifecycle implementation, in the render(javax.faces.context.FacesContext) method, if the AsyncResponse.isAjaxRequest() method returns true, replaces the ResponseWriter and ResponseStream in the current FacesContext with instances that take no action before calling the original render() method. Otherwise, it simply calls the parent implementation. Upon return from the render method it replaces the ResponseWriter and ResponseStream instance with their original values. The vital necessity of this operation being done in a custom Lifecycle vs a mere PhaseListener: there is no control over the ordering in which PhaseListeners are invoked. Therefore, we need to ensure that none of them write to the response, because doing so would confuse the client.

Author:
edburns
